results.raw_content:
[Skip to main content](#main-content)






# Regional Operations Manager



#### [Foodtastic](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/foodtastic?trk=public_jobs_topcard-org-name) Montreal, Quebec, Canada 3 days ago 69 applicants [See who Foodtastic has hired for this role](https://www.linkedin.com/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fsearch%2Fresults%2Fpeople%2F%3FfacetCurrentCompany%3D10967386%26title%3DRegional%2BOperations%2BManager&emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&trk=public_jobs_see-who-was-hired_people-search-link_face-pile-cta)

## Security verification

[Save](https://www.linkedin.com/login?emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fca.linkedin.com%2Fjobs%2Fview%2Fregional-operations-manager-at-foodtastic-4291361370&trk=public_jobs)

* [Report this job](https://www.linkedin.com/uas/login?fromSignIn=true&session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fca.linkedin.com%2Fjobs%2Fview%2Fregional-operations-manager-at-foodtastic-4291361370&trk=public_jobs_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=JOB&_f=guest-reporting)

**À propos de nous**

Fondé en 2016, Foodtastic est une des plus grandes compagnies de restaurants au Canada. Durant les cinq dernières années, les ventes totales de l’ensemble des restaurants sont passées de 50mm de $ à plus de 1 milliard de $. Notre portfolio de 27 chaînes de restaurants inclus Milestones, Second Cup, Pita Pit, Quesada, La Belle et La Boeuf et les Rôtisseries Benny.

Nous sommes dévoués à créer des relations extraordinaires avec nos franchisés et offrir à tous nos client une expérience culinaire mémorable. Notre croissance ne serait pas possible sans la créativité, le dévouement et l'esprit entrepreneurial de nos collaborateurs. Nous continuons à développer l'équipe et sommes toujours à la recherche de candidats exceptionnels pour joindre Foodtastic.

**Gestionnaire des opérations régionales**

Sous la supervision du Directeur des Opérations, le Gestionnaire des opérations régionales **supervise les restaurants en Ontario et Québec**. Il collabore avec les gérants et franchisés pour développer les compétences nécessaires, réalise des audits pour garantir le respect des normes de la marque, et met en place des plans d'action pour améliorer les performances. Il est responsable des indicateurs financiers, de la performance, de la satisfaction client, de la sécurité alimentaire et de l'engagement des employés dans sa région.

**Responsabilités :**

Offrir une expérience parfaite aux clients

* Établir une relation de confiance avec les gérants et franchisés grce à des visites ciblées et de qualité.
* Effectuer des évaluations régulières selon les plans annuels de la marque.
* Vérifier les normes de marque : accueil, arrière-boutique, sécurité, relations employés, salubrité alimentaire.
* Observer, évaluer et noter les restaurants selon l’audit préétabli.
* Offrir du coaching en temps réel pour encourager le changement de comportement.
* Communiquer les normes de marque et partager les ressources disponibles.
* Identifier les lacunes, déterminer les causes et proposer des solutions concrètes.
* Résoudre les problèmes soulevés lors des audits et en faire le suivi.
* Assurer la liaison entre les restaurants et l’équipe de direction pour adresser les enjeux.
* Préparer les audits avec une bonne connaissance des performances et historiques des restaurants.
* Gérer l'ouverture de nouveaux restaurants et les aider à atteindre leurs objectifs.
* Visiter les restaurants selon la fréquence définie par le modèle de segmentation.
* Offrir un soutien marketing à divers franchisés.

**Développement des autres - Engagement des associés**

* Encadrer et développer les employés pour qu'ils puissent offrir des expériences aux clients et suivre leurs plans de développement individuels pour les sites de l'entreprise.
* Encadrer les employés afin de leur fournir un retour d'information sur leur développement et d'accroître leur capacité de leadership au sein des restaurants.
* Veiller à ce que la région soit dotée des bonnes personnes en respectant le processus de sélection approuvé, en développant et en fidélisant d'excellents associés et en maintenant un vivier de candidats prêts à occuper les postes vacants.

**Finances et rentabilité:**

* Établir des objectifs commerciaux et financiers clairs avec le directeur et les franchisés.
* Proposer des améliorations opérationnelles qui permettent d'augmenter les ventes du même restaurant ou de réduire les coûts.
* Identifier les opportunités et les meilleures pratiques pour améliorer la rentabilité des restaurants.
* Effectuer une mise à jour trimestrielle de l'activité pour la région.

**Alimentation/sécurité:**

* Veiller au respect des normes d'emploi, des droits de l'homme, de la santé et de la sécurité dans la région.
* Veiller à la mise en œuvre efficace et au respect des programmes de sécurité alimentaire.

**Voici quelques-uns des défis à relever dans le cadre de cette fonction:**

* Géographie - plusieurs unités réparties sur un vaste territoire peuvent nécessiter des déplacements.
* Capacité à travailler avec différents types de personnalités.
* Il doit être capable d'identifier les talents et d'aider les dirigeants à développer de solides compétences en matière de leadership.
* Établir des relations solides et cohésives avec le centre de soutien des restaurants et les équipes sur le terrain.
* Se tenir au courant de toutes les normes et de tous les changements relatifs à la marque.
* Comprendre clairement les spécifications des menus.
* Être capable de mener des audits détaillés tout au long de l'année.
* Obtenir l'adoption et la durabilité des nouveaux systèmes et outils dans l'ensemble de la marque.
* Il doit être capable d'animer des ateliers/présentations.

**Exigences :**

* 5 ans d'expérience dans la restauration franchisée à plusieurs unités
* Doit être bilingue en français et en anglais (déplacements entre le Québec et l’Ontario)
* Certification MAPAQ en hygiène et salubrité alimentaire
* Pensée stratégique & orienté vers les résultats
* Solides compétences en communication et gestions des conflicts.
* Capacité d'influence efficace et solides compétences en matière de travail d'équipe
* Permis de conduite valide et accès à un véhicule

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

**About the Company**

Founded in 2016, Foodtastic is already one of the largest restaurant companies in Canada. We have increased system sales in the last five years from less than $50mm to over $1B. Our current portfolio of 27 brands includes Milestones Grill & Bar, Second Cup Café, Pita Pit, Quesada, La Belle et La Boeuf, and Rôtisseries Benny.

We are passionate about building our franchisee partnerships and providing our guests with a memorable dining experience. Our growth would not be possible without our people's creativity, dedication, and entrepreneurship. We continue to build the team and always look for exceptional candidates to join Foodtastic.

**Regional Operations Manager**

Reporting to the Director of Operations, the Regional Operations Manager is the main contact for **restaurants in Ontario and Quebec.** They work with Managers and Franchisees to build capabilities and ensure results. The role includes conducting audits to maintain brand standards and creating action plans to boost performance. The ROM is responsible for financial and operational metrics such as sales, guest experience, food safety, and employee engagement in their region.

**Responsabilities:**

Deliver a Perfect Guest Experience

* Build strong relationships with Managers and Franchisees through focused, purposeful restaurant visits.
* Conduct regular evaluations as per brand plans (Front/Back of House, safety, food handling, etc.).
* Audit and score restaurants based on brand standards.
* Provide real-time coaching to drive behavioral change.
* Share brand standards and resources to address performance gaps.
* Identify root causes of issues and share findings with leadership.
* Offer solutions and training to address identified gaps.
* Flag and resolve key issues from audits; track trends and follow up.
* Act as a liaison between field teams and brand leadership to resolve guest experience issues.
* Prepare for audits by reviewing financial performance and previous audit outcomes.
* Lead new restaurant openings and support them in achieving targets.
* Visit restaurants according to segmentation model frequency.
* Support marketing efforts across multiple franchise brands

**Development of others – Associate Engagement:**

* Coach and develop employees to deliver Guest Experiences and on their individual development plans for corporate locations, and provide feedback to increase leadership capabilities.
* Ensure that the region is fully staffed with the right people by adhering to approved selection process, developing and retaining great Associates and maintaining a pipeline of candidates ready to fill vacancies.

**Financial and Profitability:**

* Establish clear business goals and financial targets with Manager and Franchisees
* Suggest operational improvements that drive same Restaurant sales or reduce costs
* Identify opportunities and best practices to improve profitability of restaurants
* Conduct quarterly business update for region.

**Food/Safety:**

* Ensure compliance with employment standards, human rights, health and safety, and WHMIS within the region.
* Ensure effective implementation and compliance of the Food Safety Programs.

**Some of the challenges in this role could include:**

* Geographic – multi units across large territory will require travel.
* Ability to work with a variety of personality types.
* Must be able to identify talent and assist leaders in developing strong leadership skills.
* Building strong and cohesive relationships with Restaurants Support Centre and Field teams.
* Must stay up on all brand standards and changes.
* Must clearly understand menu specifications.
* Must be able to conduct detailed audits routinely throughout the year.
* Must be able to facilitate workshops/presentations.

**Requirements:**

* 5 years experience in multi-unit franchise restaurant
* Must be bilingual in French and English (travel between Quebec and Ontario)
* MAPAQ Certification in Food Hygiene and Safety
* Strategic thinking & Results-oriented
* Strong communication & conflict management skills.
* Strong teamwork skills
* Training experience is required
* Valid driver’s license and access to a vehicle

* ### Seniority level

  Director
* ### Employment type

  Full-time
* ### Job function

  Training, Other, and Customer Service
* ### Industries

[## Director, Operations Solutions, Operational Excellence](https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/director-operations-solutions-operational-excellence-at-mufg-investor-services-4283964746?trk=public_jobs_topcard-title)



#### [MUFG Investor Services](https://www.linkedin.com/company/mufg-investor-services?trk=public_jobs_topcard-org-name) Toronto, Ontario, Canada 1 week ago [See who MUFG Investor Services has hired for this role](https://www.linkedin.com/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fsearch%2Fresults%2Fpeople%2F%3FfacetCurrentCompany%3D3486817&emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&trk=public_jobs_see-who-was-hired_people-search-link_face-pile-cta)

[Save](https://www.linkedin.com/login?emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fca.linkedin.com%2Fjobs%2Fview%2Fdirector-operations-solutions-operational-excellence-at-mufg-investor-services-4283964746&trk=public_jobs)

**Company Description****About MUFG Investor Services:**MUFG Investor Services provides asset servicing solutions to the global investment management industry. Leveraging the financial and intellectual capital of MUFG – one of the largest banks in the world with $2.8 trillion in assets – we provide clients access to a range of leading solutions from fund administration, middle-office outsourcing, custody, foreign exchange, trustee services and depository to securities lending and other banking services.  
  
With a diverse and dynamic network of offices across the globe, MUFG Investor Services provides challenging and rewarding careers. We achieve this by offering continuous learning and development, collaborative team work environment, promotion of work-life integration, and exposure to a wide variety of work.  
  
Imagine your future at MUFG Investor Services where you can grow professionally, in a diverse and inclusive workplace that rewards your contribution.  
  
**Job Description****Reporting to the Executive Director, Head of Operations Solutions, you will:**

* Act as an SME lead on projects that support strategy achievement by contributing to the redesign of new business models; streamlining processes and implementing sustainable business changes
* Scope and deliver operational excellence projects within agreed deadlines and budgets
* Facilitate engagements with clients through workshops to release capacity, increase operational efficiency, remove errors in operational functions
* Use recognized business / process modelling tools (e.g. BPMN 2.0 / UML), methodologies (e.g. Lean) to support project delivery
* Analyze & simplify complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations
* Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.
* Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.
* Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.
* Coach and mentor team members on operational excellence methodologies and practices
* Utilize your skills in the areas of structured problem solving, business analysis, analytics, design thinking and lean process improvement to help our clients drive profitability and performance through their business operations
* Coordinating workshops and delivering formal and informal reports and presentation

**Qualifications****You Have:**

* 5+ years work experience in the Fund Administration industry
* A relevant primary or advanced degree e.g. business, engineering, MBA or equivalent
* Previous experience in delivery of effective process redesign projects using known methodologies
* A great understanding of core business operations or operational excellence in the funds industry
* Strong knowledge of business process design, improvement, and management (BPR, BPI, BPM) concepts and approaches.
* Experience of data capture and gap analysis – through a process, system and people focus, mapping out a clear picture of what needs to be done, adopting, and employing the most appropriate methodologies and approaches (e.g. data mining to identify issues and challenges with As-is processes) to identify issues and challenges
* Proven ability to effectively identify process improvement opportunities; creatively developing approaches for business problem solving and ability to evaluate the trade-offs between business value drivers and costs.
* Strong understanding of business and operational KPIs and metrics, that will facilitate change implementation and measure expected benefits

**Preferred**

* Lean Six Sigma Certification (e.g. Green Belt, Black Belt)
* Agile design experience/ certification preferred

**Additional Information**At MUFG Investor Services, we are exceptionally proud of our approach to Hybrid Working. It enables the flexibility to thrive from wherever our employees work and, stay connected to their team and our culture. When we make Hybrid Working plans, we get to know the individual and pride ourselves in underpinning all our decisions with fairness and consistency.  
  
MUFG Investor Services provides all of its employees with an extremely attractive compensation package. In addition to base salary, there is a group medical insurance scheme, group pension scheme, reimbursement of professional subscriptions, paid holidays and assistance towards gym memberships.  
  
We thank all candidates for applying; however, only those proceeding to the interview stage will be contacted. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only to provide an accessible candidate experience.  
  
**MUFG is an equal opportunity employer.**

* ### Seniority level

  Director
* ### Employment type

  Full-time
* ### Job function

  Finance
* ### Industries

  Financial Services

# Restaurants Canada
The voice of foodservice | La voix des services alimentaires
Non-profit Organizations • Toronto, Ontario • 37,784 followers • 11-50 employees

## Overview
Restaurants Canada is a national, not-for-profit member-based trade association advancing the potential of Canada’s diverse and dynamic foodservice industry through member programs, research, advocacy, resources and events. Canada’s foodservice sector is a $100 billion industry that serves 22 million customers across the country every day. As the fourth-largest private-sector employer, Canadian foodservice directly employs 1.2 million people and indirectly supports another 290,000+ jobs in related industries, with $32 billion in food and beverage products purchased every year. www.restaurantscanada.org

## Posts
**Restaurants Canada** (1d): Yesterday we had the pleasure of enjoying a delicious Osmow’s staff lunch—an extended celebration to congratulate the team on the re-opening of their original Streetsville location, the very spot where the Osmow's journey began over 20 years ago. Cheers to many more years of success! 🎉 👏 [Likes: 26, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (2d): Generations may differ, but they all matter. 51% of Millennials dine out weekly, compared to 35% of Boomers. Gen X spends the most at restaurants, and Gen Z is reshaping discovery through social media. Learn more and stay ahead — Start reading the 2025 Foodservice Facts report here: https://bit.ly/4nOzY0U #FoodserviceFacts2025 #Foodservice #Hospitality #data #consumertrends [Likes: 29, Comments: 0]; **Recipe Unlimited Corporation** (3d 4d Edited): We’re proud to share that our CEO, Frank Hennessey, has been honoured with a Lifetime Achievement Award at this year’s Rotman Alumni Awards. This recognition celebrates Frank’s remarkable leadership, vision, and impact on the Canadian restaurant industry and beyond. Throughout his career, Frank has not only guided Recipe through growth and transformation but has also inspired those around him with his commitment to people, innovation, and community. Congratulations, Frank, on this well-deserved honour! [Likes: 42, Comments: 0]; **Foodservice and Hospitality magazine** (3d): Mark von Schellwitz , Restaurants Canada ’s VP of Western Canada, has announced his retirement after more than 28 years with the organization. https://lnkd.in/gX9zey_F [Likes: 105, Comments: 85]; **Restaurants Canada** (3d): In this episode, we sit down with Chris Elliott , Chief Economist & Vice President, Research at Restaurants Canada, to unpack some of the biggest surprises from 2025: to explore the surprising 2025 sales rebound, how the GST holiday gave operators more than a breather, and why domestic tourism was the quiet hero keeping restaurants busy. Chris takes us behind the numbers—like why alcohol sales are slipping, why solo dining is on the rise, and how his POST strategy (Pricing, Operations, Staffing, Technology) can help operators tackle rising costs head-on. We also dig into the hot topics shaping menus and margins plus the real power of using data to make smarter moves. Most importantly, Chris shares why Foodservice Facts should be every operator’s secret weapon and gives us a peek into what’s ahead in 2026. Listen for: • Why sales are up—but profits aren’t • The hidden cost of ignoring productivity • What’s really changing on Canadian menus • How operators can use data to stay competitive 🎧 Tune in now on Spotify: https://bit.ly/42Yr9JV #MENUUnplugged #podcast #FoodserviceFacts #restaurants #data _____________________ 🎙️MENU Unplugged Podcast is a co-production of Restaurants Canada & Benchmark Sixty Restaurant Services 🎙️This episode sponsored by Groupex Canada [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (4d): Restaurants Canada's 2025 Foodservice Facts report found that 8 in 10 young Canadians have cut back on restaurant spending because of rising living costs. Western Canada VP, Mark von Schellwitz joined CTV Vancouver to talk about what government can do to help Canadians struggling with affordability. Watch the full interview here: https://bit.ly/46KcCCC [Likes: 12, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (5d): It was a big week back in Ottawa for Restaurants Canada as we continued our conversations and lobby work around immigration, temporary foreign workers, removing GST from all food and strengthening the viability of the foodservice sector during this period of economic uncertainty. Our message is gaining traction—conversations with key decision-makers confirm they’re listening to our advocacy on affordability, workforce, and related issues. The response to our FOODISFOOD.CA campaign was very positive and gaining more interest. Additionally, we were able to share important context, real data and information on the use of temporary foreign workers. While this remains a complex issue for our sector, it’s essential we use these programs responsibly and continue to uphold the industry’s integrity and reputation. Read President & CEO, KELLY HIGGINSON 's full update here: https://bit.ly/42JsBje [Likes: 15, Comments: 1]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): 🌍✈️Happy World Tourism Day! This year's theme, "Tourism and Sustainable Transformation," is a call to action for all of us. From coast to coast to coast, tourism is a powerful force that drives our economy, industry, celebrates our culture, and connects us with the world. Our vibrant food scene plays a massive role in this! Every time you dine at a local restaurant, you're not just enjoying a meal, you're supporting a network of local producers, farmers, fishers, and chefs. You're helping to sustain jobs and preserve the unique culinary traditions that define our diverse communities. 💡Fun Fact: The restaurant industry accounts for approximately one third of all tourism-related jobs—making it the largest employer within the tourism sector. #WorldTourismDay #SustainableTourism #ExploreCanada #SupportLocal [Likes: 11, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): Restaurants Canada is deeply concerned about the nationwide strike launched by the Canadian Union of Postal Workers as Canadians and businesses cannot afford continued disruption. Read our full statement here: https://bit.ly/4myFELp [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): The Temporary Foreign Worker Program represents just 3% of the foodservice workforce, but it fills a critical need for rural, remote and tourism communities. Restaurants Canada's KELLY HIGGINSON joined CBC's Ontario Today to discuss the reality of the foodservice industry's workforce needs. Listen to the full episode here: https://bit.ly/46pSTJQ [Likes: 11, Comments: 1]

results.raw_content:
# Restaurants Canada
The voice of foodservice | La voix des services alimentaires
Non-profit Organizations • Toronto, Ontario • 37,784 followers • 11-50 employees

## Overview
Restaurants Canada is a national, not-for-profit member-based trade association advancing the potential of Canada’s diverse and dynamic foodservice industry through member programs, research, advocacy, resources and events. Canada’s foodservice sector is a $100 billion industry that serves 22 million customers across the country every day. As the fourth-largest private-sector employer, Canadian foodservice directly employs 1.2 million people and indirectly supports another 290,000+ jobs in related industries, with $32 billion in food and beverage products purchased every year. www.restaurantscanada.org

## Posts
**Restaurants Canada** (1d): Yesterday we had the pleasure of enjoying a delicious Osmow’s staff lunch—an extended celebration to congratulate the team on the re-opening of their original Streetsville location, the very spot where the Osmow's journey began over 20 years ago. Cheers to many more years of success! 🎉 👏 [Likes: 26, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (2d): Generations may differ, but they all matter. 51% of Millennials dine out weekly, compared to 35% of Boomers. Gen X spends the most at restaurants, and Gen Z is reshaping discovery through social media. Learn more and stay ahead — Start reading the 2025 Foodservice Facts report here: https://bit.ly/4nOzY0U #FoodserviceFacts2025 #Foodservice #Hospitality #data #consumertrends [Likes: 29, Comments: 0]; **Recipe Unlimited Corporation** (3d 4d Edited): We’re proud to share that our CEO, Frank Hennessey, has been honoured with a Lifetime Achievement Award at this year’s Rotman Alumni Awards. This recognition celebrates Frank’s remarkable leadership, vision, and impact on the Canadian restaurant industry and beyond. Throughout his career, Frank has not only guided Recipe through growth and transformation but has also inspired those around him with his commitment to people, innovation, and community. Congratulations, Frank, on this well-deserved honour! [Likes: 42, Comments: 0]; **Foodservice and Hospitality magazine** (3d): Mark von Schellwitz , Restaurants Canada ’s VP of Western Canada, has announced his retirement after more than 28 years with the organization. https://lnkd.in/gX9zey_F [Likes: 105, Comments: 85]; **Restaurants Canada** (3d): In this episode, we sit down with Chris Elliott , Chief Economist & Vice President, Research at Restaurants Canada, to unpack some of the biggest surprises from 2025: to explore the surprising 2025 sales rebound, how the GST holiday gave operators more than a breather, and why domestic tourism was the quiet hero keeping restaurants busy. Chris takes us behind the numbers—like why alcohol sales are slipping, why solo dining is on the rise, and how his POST strategy (Pricing, Operations, Staffing, Technology) can help operators tackle rising costs head-on. We also dig into the hot topics shaping menus and margins plus the real power of using data to make smarter moves. Most importantly, Chris shares why Foodservice Facts should be every operator’s secret weapon and gives us a peek into what’s ahead in 2026. Listen for: • Why sales are up—but profits aren’t • The hidden cost of ignoring productivity • What’s really changing on Canadian menus • How operators can use data to stay competitive 🎧 Tune in now on Spotify: https://bit.ly/42Yr9JV #MENUUnplugged #podcast #FoodserviceFacts #restaurants #data _____________________ 🎙️MENU Unplugged Podcast is a co-production of Restaurants Canada & Benchmark Sixty Restaurant Services 🎙️This episode sponsored by Groupex Canada [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (4d): Restaurants Canada's 2025 Foodservice Facts report found that 8 in 10 young Canadians have cut back on restaurant spending because of rising living costs. Western Canada VP, Mark von Schellwitz joined CTV Vancouver to talk about what government can do to help Canadians struggling with affordability. Watch the full interview here: https://bit.ly/46KcCCC [Likes: 12, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (5d): It was a big week back in Ottawa for Restaurants Canada as we continued our conversations and lobby work around immigration, temporary foreign workers, removing GST from all food and strengthening the viability of the foodservice sector during this period of economic uncertainty. Our message is gaining traction—conversations with key decision-makers confirm they’re listening to our advocacy on affordability, workforce, and related issues. The response to our FOODISFOOD.CA campaign was very positive and gaining more interest. Additionally, we were able to share important context, real data and information on the use of temporary foreign workers. While this remains a complex issue for our sector, it’s essential we use these programs responsibly and continue to uphold the industry’s integrity and reputation. Read President & CEO, KELLY HIGGINSON 's full update here: https://bit.ly/42JsBje [Likes: 15, Comments: 1]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): 🌍✈️Happy World Tourism Day! This year's theme, "Tourism and Sustainable Transformation," is a call to action for all of us. From coast to coast to coast, tourism is a powerful force that drives our economy, industry, celebrates our culture, and connects us with the world. Our vibrant food scene plays a massive role in this! Every time you dine at a local restaurant, you're not just enjoying a meal, you're supporting a network of local producers, farmers, fishers, and chefs. You're helping to sustain jobs and preserve the unique culinary traditions that define our diverse communities. 💡Fun Fact: The restaurant industry accounts for approximately one third of all tourism-related jobs—making it the largest employer within the tourism sector. #WorldTourismDay #SustainableTourism #ExploreCanada #SupportLocal [Likes: 11, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): Restaurants Canada is deeply concerned about the nationwide strike launched by the Canadian Union of Postal Workers as Canadians and businesses cannot afford continued disruption. Read our full statement here: https://bit.ly/4myFELp [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): The Temporary Foreign Worker Program represents just 3% of the foodservice workforce, but it fills a critical need for rural, remote and tourism communities. Restaurants Canada's KELLY HIGGINSON joined CBC's Ontario Today to discuss the reality of the foodservice industry's workforce needs. Listen to the full episode here: https://bit.ly/46pSTJQ [Likes: 11, Comments: 1]

This will be a remote role to start, with plans to transition to hybrid in-office 2x/week located in downtown Toronto.With millions of diners, 60,000+ restaurant partners and 25+ years of experience, OpenTable, part of Booking Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: BKNG), is an industry leader with a passion for helping restaurants thrive. Our world-class technology empowers restaurants to focus on what matters most  their team, their guests, and their bottom line  while enabling diners to discover and book the perfect restaurant for every occasion.Every employee at OpenTable has a tangible impact on what we do and how we do it. Youll also be part of a global team and its portfolio of metasearch brands. Hospitality is all about taking care of others, and it defines our culture.**The Role**As a **Senior Product Manager**, you'll be responsible for the entire lifecycle of our self-serve restaurant ads platform, from campaign creation to performance reporting. You'll balance robust technical execution with a strong focus on user-centric design, creating intuitive and powerful tools that empower small business owners. This is a design-forward role requiring high ownership, where you'll shape how restaurants grow through OpenTable. We're looking for someone who thinks beyond features and funnels  someone passionate about building a five-star product experience for busy restaurant owners investing in their business.**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead Product Development: Own the development of OpenTable's ad campaign suite, delivering innovative, self-serve tools that enable restaurants to manage advertising campaigns and achieve measurable business growth.
* Drive User Experience: Collaborate closely with design teams to craft five-star product experiences that are both highly functional and aesthetically pleasing.
* Leverage Data & AI: Utilize AI and data science to develop solutions that optimize ad targeting, budget management, and campaign performance based on real-time diner behavior and restaurant demand.
* Innovate Monetization Strategies: Experiment with auction-based pricing, personalized recommendations, and real-time adjustments to enhance marketplace efficiency and drive revenue growth.
* Ensure Seamless Integration: Guarantee that ad campaigns seamlessly integrate with the broader marketplace, effectively balancing supply and demand while maintaining a positive experience for both diners and restaurants.

**Qualifications**

* Experience: 5+ years of product management experience, with a strong portfolio of shipping customer-facing products that successfully balance technical execution with user-centric design.
* Industry Knowledge: Proven experience in B2B SaaS, ad platforms, or marketplace products, with a focus on creating intuitive and impactful user experiences.
* Skills: Exceptional collaboration, analytical, and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across diverse cross-functional teams.
* Passion: A genuine passion for solving problems for small business owners and a commitment to creating products that are both functional and beautiful.

**Benefits And Perks**

* Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
* Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
* Focus on mental health and well-being:

+ Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
+ Company-paid subscription to Headspace
+ Annual company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)

* Paid parental leave
* Paid volunteer time
* Focus on your career growth:

+ Development Dollars
+ Leadership development
+ Access to thousands of on-demand e-learnings

* Travel Discounts
* Employee Resource Groups
* Private health and dental insurance
* Life and Disability insurance

There are a variety of factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. The range for this Toronto, Canada based role is $120,000-$150,000 CAD.We offer a competitive base salary and benefits including: health benefits; flexible spending account; retirement benefits; life insurance; paid time off (including PTO, paid sick leave, medical leave, bereavement leave, floating holidays and paid holidays); and parental leave benefits. This role is eligible to be considered for an annual bonus and equity grant.**Work Environment & Flexibility**At OpenTable, we pride ourselves on fostering a global and dynamic work environment. As a team member with us, you will benefit from a schedule tailored to accommodate a global workforce operating across multiple time zones. While the majority of your responsibilities may align with conventional business hours, there will be instances where you are expected to manage communications - via calls, Slack messages, or emails - outside of regular working hours to effectively collaborate with international colleagues, respond to restaurant partners, and/or address urgent matters. OpenTable will always abide by and consider local laws and regulations.**Inclusion**Were committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels they belong and can thrive. We know the best ideas come when we bring different voices to the table, so we're building a team as dynamic as the diners and restaurants we serveand fostering a culture where everyone feels welcome to be themselves.If you need accommodations during the application or interview process, or on the job, were here to support you. Please reach out to your recruiter to request any accommodations.

# Michelle Quaranta **Category Manager | Small Business Owner | Specializing in Retail** Toronto, Ontario, Canada, CA 500 connections, 769 followers ## About An absolute fashionista with a passion for retail that started at a young age and developed into 16 years of experience (front line and head office) supported by a foundation of university and college courses

## Experience ### Category Manager, Home & Lifestyle [Well.ca](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/well-ca) Jun 2022 - Present N/A ### Small Business Owner [Style Talks](N/A) Nov 2021 - Present Toronto, Ontario, Canada STYLE TALKS is an image consulting company that is focused on helping it’s customers look and feel like the best versions of themselves. We provide learning, guidance and direction on how to achieve your ultimate style goals. From decluttering and reorganizing your closet, to tackling the intimidating mall experience. We help build the important foundation of style/colour theory/body imaging. STYLE TALKS BRINGS STYLE STRAIGHT TO YOUR DOORSTEP. We work with your needs, on your time, at your convenience. ### Associate Category Manager, Wellness [Indigo](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/indigo) Jul 2019 - Jun 2022 Toronto, Canada Area ### adidas [adidas](https://de.linkedin.com/company/adidas?trk=public_profile_experience-group-header) N/A - Present Woodbridge ### Assistant Merchandise Manager [Aritzia](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/aritzia) May 2011 - May 2012 Sherway Gardens • Assist Merchandise Manager during peak season • Manage shipping and receiving team • Balance out optimum units levels throughout the store • Merchandise in-store displays as well as window mannequins• Schedule employee’s breaks and check sections to ensure maintenance is up to standard ## Education ### Ryerson University Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.), Retail Management 2012 - 2015 Activities and Societies: Greg Crombie RAC Competition, Leaders in Retail Conference, Ted Rogers Management Conference Delegate, Ted Rogers Management Conference -Competed in a challenging case study to provide a compelling sales strategy for an innovative engineering idea Award Recipient, Leaders in Retail Conference -Competitive award for the first place category for most innovative pop-up concept -Consulted with industry professionals to produce a feasible and viable idea for a pop-up store located in downtown Toronto Award Recipient, Greg Crombie RAC Competition -Received… Show more ### Humber College Diploma, Fashion Arts 2010 - 2012 All courses pertaining to the fashion industry from a business perspective Graduated with honours ## Publications N/A ## Honors & Awards N/A ## Certifications Excel with Macros and VBA Record of Achievement (George Brown College) ## Volunteering - Womenswear Allocation Intern Holt Renfrew Education N/A; results.title: Ben Sachse - Operations and Finance Manager
results.content:
Ben Sachse
Operations and Finance Manager
Elora, Ontario, Canada
414 connections, 416 followers


About
"There is an intersection between the human experience, food, and design, that allows for endless exploration and possibilities. " As a confident Chef, and recently Project Manager, I am keenly aware of the importance of the connection between the mechanics and systems of any organization, and the workforce for which, and because of which, it exists. Hospitality is an industry that offers boundless opportunities for making the world a better place. I have a proven track record of delivering effective management systems for my employers and personal ventures. My 16 years in the Hospitality Industry, as Chef, Restaurant Owner, and Hospitality Group Project Manager, has offered me insight and experiences that go beyond traditional F&B roles. I have been integral in the creation of vibrant, energetic hospitality businesses in Elora and St Jacobs. (see The Elora Brewing Company, The Butcher&The Market) In 2020, I took on a roll as Project Manager for a growing Hospitality company, the Fat Sparrow Group, embracing a role quite new. I have taken a headlong dive into Construction Project management, Inventory and Procurement, Control and reporting, Cost of Good management, and Procedures Development. A more detailed background: Born in Switzerland, I immigrated to Canada at the age of 10, growing up in the peace and solitude of small town Ontario. I studied Anthropology and Archeology at University, and later found my passion at the Stratford Chef School, graduating with Honours in 2008. I spent a year experiencing life as an apprentice at an isolated Restaurant near Osaka, Japan, and after returning to Canada, I was ultimately drawn to settle in Elora when in 2011 I was offered my first position as a head Chef.


Experience
Director of Finance And Operations
[The Bruce Hotel - Stratford Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/the-bruce-hotel---stratford-canada)  
Feb 2025 - Present
Stratford, Ontario, Canada



Education
Stratford Chef School
Honours, Classic French Cookery
2006 - 2008
None

# Ben Sachse **Operations and Finance Manager** Elora, Ontario, Canada, CA 414 connections, 416 followers ## About "There is an intersection between the human experience, food, and design, that allows for endless exploration and possibilities

" As a confident Chef, and recently Project Manager, I am keenly aware of the importance of the connection between the mechanics and systems of any organization, and the workforce for which, and because of which, it exists

Hospitality is an industry that offers boundless opportunities for making the world a better place

I have a proven track record of delivering effective management systems for my employers and personal ventures

My 16 years in the Hospitality Industry, as Chef, Restaurant Owner, and Hospitality Group Project Manager, has offered me insight and experiences that go beyond traditional F&B roles

I have been integral in the creation of vibrant, energetic hospitality businesses in Elora and St Jacobs

(see The Elora Brewing Company, The Butcher&The Market) In 2020, I took on a roll as Project Manager for a growing Hospitality company, the Fat Sparrow Group, embracing a role quite new

I have taken a headlong dive into Construction Project management, Inventory and Procurement, Control and reporting, Cost of Good management, and Procedures Development

A more detailed background: Born in Switzerland, I immigrated to Canada at the age of 10, growing up in the peace and solitude of small town Ontario

I studied Anthropology and Archeology at University, and later found my passion at the Stratford Chef School, graduating with Honours in 2008

I spent a year experiencing life as an apprentice at an isolated Restaurant near Osaka, Japan, and after returning to Canada, I was ultimately drawn to settle in Elora when in 2011 I was offered my first position as a head Chef

## Experience ### Director of Finance And Operations [The Bruce Hotel - Stratford Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/the-bruce-hotel---stratford-canada) Feb 2025 - Present Stratford, Ontario, Canada ### Project & Inventory Manager [The Stonecrock Inc](N/A) Jul 2020 - Jan 2025 St. Jacobs, Ontario, Canada PM'd Conversion/Construction of a small-town legacy business into a vibrant modern new venture. I controlled all steps from Design, costing, permitting, and completion, up to and including directing initial internal operating systems and inventory management. ### Kitchen corp owner / head chef [Elora Brewing Company](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/elora-brewing-company) Mar 2015 - Aug 2020 Elora, Ontario, Canada Leader of incredible group of skilled cooks, occasional boss, do-er of dishes, constantly learning and reinventing the wheel... ### Executive Chef [Cork Restaurant](N/A) Sep 2011 - Jan 2014 Elora, Ontario Cork restaurant was a small Wine-bar and Classic Bistro, inspired by the amazing abundance of local farmers and producers in the Centre-Wellington area. I hired and trained kitchen staff, created menus, and designed the spreadsheets and control mechanisms necessary to ensure quality control, proper food costing, inventory control, ordering lists, and the daily nitty-gritty guidelines and checklists. ### Chef de Cuisine [Wills & Co](N/A) Oct 2010 - Sep 2011 N/A Designed and executed Retail and Catering menus in a Canadian-only delicatessen / catering space. Helped bring to fruition the store's inception. Hired and trained all kitchen staff. Planned kitchen layout and organization. ### Entremetier [Stone Road Grille](N/A) Mar 2010 - Oct 2010 N/A Prepped mise-en-place for all main-dish sides for dinner service.Ran Entremetier station during dinner service. ### Apprentice [Del Cook, Osaka Japan](https://jp.linkedin.com/company/del-cook) Mar 2009 - Jan 2010 Nose, Osaka, Japan For 9 months, I had the incredible experience of cooking in the japanese countryside, just one hour's trainride from bustling Osaka city. While the food served was classically french in style and preparation, the exclusively locally grown ingredients and the inspiration they provided, were japanese in all their delightful forms. ### Garde Manger / Saucier [Oviinbyrd](N/A) Mar 2008 - Oct 2008 N/A ## Education ### Stratford Chef School Honours, Classic French Cookery 2006 - 2008 None ### Wilfrid Laurier University Cultural Anthropology 1997 - 2002 None ## Publications N/A ## Honors & Awards N/A ## Certifications Project Management online (WatSPEED at the University of Waterloo); Procore Certified: Project Manager at Owner (Preconstruction) (Procore Technologies) ## Volunteering - once in a while Guest Chef The Hospital for Sick Children Children Once in a while, I have the great honour to be invited to Marnie's lounge to make myself available to any kids wishing to spend an hour or so getting their hands dirty with some form of food. ## Languages **French** (Limited working proficiency), **German** (Native or bilingual proficiency), **English** (Full professional proficiency), **Japanese** (Elementary proficiency) ## Organizations N/A ## Activity - **Yesterday, we officially welcomed tens of thousands of new (very tiny) coworkers — a thriving colony of honey bees! 🐝🌼 As part of our continued…** Liked by Ben Sachse [View Post](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/kimberley-kerr-_yesterday-we-officially-welcomed-tens-of-activity-7340747074075844610-On8b) ![Activity Image](https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/v2/D4E22AQGChZmBKdxNGQ/feedshare-shrink_2048_1536/B4EZd.SjcoGcA0-/0/1750170483465?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=o_LqcEpGYRkUFMC33bEg7eUf9dBnCq3NA4ffu96-A-Y) - **What does over $800,000 worth of rescued food look like? **Ready to make your next big professional move? Join us on our journey to achieve our big dream of building the most loved restaurant brands in the world.** Restaurant Brands International Inc. is one of the world's largest quick service restaurant companies with nearly $45 billion in annual system-wide sales and over 32,000 restaurants in more than 120 countries and territories.RBI owns four of the world's most prominent and iconic quick service restaurant brands – TIM HORTONS®, BURGER KING®, POPEYES®, and FIREHOUSE SUBS®. These independently operated brands have been serving their respective guests, franchisees and communities for decades. Through its Restaurant Brands for Good framework, RBI is improving sustainable outcomes related to its food, the planet, and people and communities.RBI is committed to growing the TIM HORTONS®, BURGER KING®, POPEYES® and FIREHOUSE SUBS® brands by leveraging their respective core values, employee and franchisee relationships, and long track records of community support. Each brand benefits from the global scale and shared best practices that come from ownership by Restaurant Brands International Inc.**Position Overview**Reporting to the Sr. Manager, TH CPG Finance, the Manager, TH Finance will be responsible for managing all financial routines including month-end closing and reporting processes, in addition to ad hoc reporting, analyses, and financial modeling. The ideal candidate will have a finance or accounting background and the ability to interpret key financial information. The candidate should be a hands-on team player with excellent interpersonal, communication and leadership skills. They must have the ability to understand finance & accounting concepts and be able to convey information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.**Responsibilities**

* Lead the monthly closing process for Tim Hortons CPG including commentary and insights on the results
* Lead the monthly forecast process, working with business partners to forecast and drive results
* Lead the annual budget process in collaboration with the CPG business team
* Perform monthly analysis of trade spend, identifying effectiveness of promotional activity and areas for optimization
* Prepare retailer and product level financial reports, highlighting key findings and actionable insights
* Work with Corporate Accounting and Shared Services areas to ensure that results are consistent with U.S. GAAP
* Assist with various ad hoc projects and financial modeling to support business decisions as needed

**Requirements**

* 4+ years of finance or accounting experience
* High degree of comfort with Microsoft Office applications and ERP systems; SAP, OneStream and IBM Planning Analytics experience considered an asset
* Strong organizational skills required to meet tight reporting deadlines
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
* Undergraduate degree in finance or accounting an asset

Benefits at all of our global offices are focused on physical, mental and financial wellness. We offer unique and progressive benefits, including a comprehensive global paid parental leave program that supports employees as they expand their families, free telemedicine and mental wellness support.Restaurant Brands International and all of its affiliated companies (collectively, RBI) are equal opportunity and affirmative action employers that do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, provincial or federal laws, rules, or regulations. RBI's policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.

Direct message the job poster from Winchesters

[Angie Amin](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/angie-amin-3200a71b4) 

### Angie Amin

#### Recruitment Consultant at Winchesters | Finance & Accounting

**Finance Manager**

**Toronto, ON · Full-time**

**On-site (Downtown Toronto)**

**About the job**

**Manager, Finance – Real Estate**

**Toronto, ON – On-site (5 days per week)**

**$120K – $135K base + bonus + benefits**

Our client, a **leading global real estate investment and asset-management organization**, is seeking a Finance Manager to join its corporate finance team in downtown Toronto. This role will oversee financial reporting, investment operations, and debt management across a diverse North American real-estate portfolio.

The ideal candidate is a **CPA-designated finance professional** with strong technical accounting expertise, a solid understanding of IFRS and US GAAP, and proven experience leading finance teams within complex, multi-entity environments. This is a rare opportunity to join a best-in-class organization known for excellence, collaboration, and long-term career growth.

**Responsibilities**

* Oversee **financial reporting, planning, forecasting, and audit processes** for investment entities.
* Manage the **onboarding and offboarding of investments**, including fund flow, loan agreements, and purchase-price allocations.
* Prepare **valuation materials, board packages, and investor reports** analyzing key return metrics (IRR, MOC, TWR).
* Lead **debt-management and compliance activities**, supporting financing, refinancing, and acquisitions.
* Supervise and mentor a **team of 3 + finance professionals**, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and professional growth.
* Maintain **intercompany reconciliations** and strengthen internal controls.
* Partner cross-functionally with **tax, asset-management, and capital-markets** teams to optimize performance and reporting.

**Requirements**

* CPA designation (CPA, CA preferred).
* 8 + years of progressive accounting and finance experience, ideally with exposure to **real estate or capital-markets**.
* Strong technical knowledge of **IFRS, US GAAP, and consolidations**.
* Advanced Excel proficiency; experience with **Yardi, OneStream, or similar** systems is an asset.
* Demonstrated experience **managing and developing finance teams**.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills with a high attention to detail.

If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, please apply!.

Due to the volume of applicants, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

* ### Seniority level

   Mid-Senior level
* ### Employment type

   Full-time
* ### Job function

   Accounting/Auditing, Finance, and Management
* ### Industries

   Staffing and Recruiting, Real Estate, and Accounting

Bookkeeping vs. Accounting in Canada: Understanding the Differences and Importance for Your Business
====================================================================================================

*   [Report this article](https://www.linkedin.com/uas/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fpulse%2Fbookkeeping-vs-accounting-canada-understanding-differences-cahje&trk=article-ssr-frontend-pulse_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=PONCHO_ARTICLE&_f=guest-reporting)

[Accountor CPA](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/accountor-cpa)![Image 3: Accountor CPA](https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/v2/D560BAQEx6zs6-SghkQ/company-logo_100_100/B56ZlQTNufG0AQ-/0/1757988838942/accountor_cpa_logo?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=mW09fNVsY25_GNajpr2ZCjg_by6-ECS3qXiv8PGhUbM)

### Accountor CPA

#### The Financial Team you can Count on.

 Published Oct 30, 2024 

[+ Follow](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=%2Fpulse%2Fbookkeeping-vs-accounting-canada-understanding-differences-cahje&trk=article-ssr-frontend-pulse_publisher-author-card)

For Canadian businesses, navigating finances is essential to long-term success. Two critical components of financial management—bookkeeping and accounting—often overlap, yet they serve distinct functions and offer unique benefits. Knowing the differences between bookkeeping and accounting can help business owners make informed decisions, improve financial health, and streamline operations.

### What Is Bookkeeping?

Bookkeeping is the process of recording all daily financial transactions of a business. Bookkeepers keep a detailed record of cash flow, including expenses, income, purchases, and sales. While often viewed as a foundational element of financial management, bookkeeping serves as the basis for more advanced accounting tasks.

Key functions of bookkeeping include:

*   Recording Transactions: Documenting all financial transactions in a ledger, whether manually or digitally.
*   Tracking Income and Expenses: Monitoring cash flow to ensure accurate income and expense records.
*   Maintaining Receipts and Invoices: Keeping physical or digital records of all transactions to validate and verify entries.
*   Bank Reconciliation: Cross-checking the company’s records with bank statements to ensure accuracy.
*   Payroll Processing: Managing employee payments, deductions, and payroll taxes.

### What Is Accounting?

Accounting is a broader and more analytical process that builds on the data recorded in bookkeeping. Accountants interpret, classify, and summarize financial information to provide insights into a business's financial health. They also prepare reports for tax filings, regulatory compliance, and strategic decision-making.

Key functions of accounting include:

*   Financial Reporting: Preparing balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements, and other financial documents.
*   Tax Preparation and Compliance: Ensuring that all tax obligations are met, preparing tax returns, and managing deductions.
*   Financial Analysis: Assessing financial data to provide insights into profitability, cash flow, and growth opportunities.
*   Budgeting and Forecasting: Creating financial projections to guide future business decisions and track performance.
*   Audit Preparation: Organizing financial records and creating reports for internal or external audits.

### How Bookkeeping and Accounting Work Together

Bookkeeping and accounting are complementary; bookkeeping provides the data foundation that accounting relies on to offer insights. Bookkeepers keep meticulous records, ensuring all transactions are recorded accurately. Accountants then take this information, analyze it, and provide strategic advice to help guide the business.

For example, while a bookkeeper might record monthly expenses, an accountant could analyze these records to identify cost-saving opportunities, forecast future expenses, and recommend budget adjustments.

### Bookkeeping and Accounting Requirements in Canada

In Canada, both bookkeepers and accountants play important roles in business finance management, but accounting requirements are generally more stringent due to tax and regulatory demands. The Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) mandates that businesses maintain accurate and up-to-date records for tax purposes, which both bookkeepers and accountants contribute to.

*   Bookkeepers in Canada may not require certification, but training in bookkeeping software like QuickBooks or Xero is often beneficial.
*   Accountants typically have certifications, such as a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation, which requires education, examination, and experience. A CPA can assist with complex financial analysis, tax planning, and regulatory compliance.

### Benefits of Bookkeeping and Accounting for Canadian Businesses

For Canadian businesses, effective bookkeeping and accounting bring numerous benefits, including:

1.   Financial Clarity: Accurate records from bookkeeping provide clarity on cash flow, which supports business stability and growth.
2.   Tax Compliance: Accountants help ensure that Canadian businesses meet CRA requirements, file taxes accurately, and take advantage of eligible deductions.
3.   Informed Decision-Making: Financial reports prepared by accountants enable data-driven decisions, helping businesses identify opportunities for growth and manage risks.
4.   Cost Management: Analyzing expenses and cash flow helps businesses control costs, improve budgeting, and enhance profitability.
5.   Preparedness for Audits: Well-maintained records simplify the audit process, whether conducted internally or by CRA.

### Choosing Between Bookkeeping and Accounting Services in Canada

Businesses in Canada can often benefit from both bookkeeping and accounting services, though the need will vary based on the company’s size, complexity, and financial requirements.

*   For Startups and Small Businesses: Outsourcing bookkeeping can help new businesses maintain accurate records without hiring a full-time bookkeeper. Accounting services can be used periodically for tax filing, compliance, and financial advice.
*   For Growing and Medium-Sized Businesses: Regular bookkeeping and monthly or quarterly accounting services provide continuous oversight and financial analysis to support scaling efforts.
*   For Large Businesses: Full-time in-house bookkeepers and accountants may be necessary to manage ongoing transactions, complex financial data, and strategic planning.

### Conclusion

Understanding the difference between bookkeeping and accounting is essential for Canadian business owners. Bookkeeping lays the groundwork by maintaining accurate records of daily transactions, while accounting builds on these records to provide valuable financial insights and strategic guidance. Both are crucial for compliance, effective financial management, and long-term growth.

Whether handled in-house or outsourced, robust bookkeeping and accounting practices help Canadian businesses stay organized, comply with CRA regulations, and position themselves for success.
